intro: Phalacraea ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian phalacraea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as cloud forests. Its leaves are ovate with a rough texture, and it produces capsule fruits containing small seeds. Phalacraea ecuadorensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
